title: Simplifying Single Square Root Denominators
text: Given an expression with a single square root radical term in the denominator, to rationalize the denominator ultiply the numerator and denominator by the radical in the denominator.

title: Simplifying Single Square Root Denominators
text: The radical in the denominator is $$\sqrt{2}$$. So multiply the fraction by $$\frac{\sqrt{2}}{\sqrt{2}}$$.

title: The Product Rule for Simplifying Square Roots
text: If a and b are nonnegative, the square root of the product ab is equal to the product of the square roots of a and b: $$\sqrt{ab}=\sqrt{a} \sqrt{b}$$

title: The Product Rule for Simplifying Square Roots
text: Use the product rule to simplify the expression: 12*sqrt(3)/sqrt(2)*[sqrt(2)/sqrt(2)]=12*sqrt(6)/2=6*sqrt(6)
